result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:33 AM Defendant Joshua Scott Sokolik appeared by phone.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Joshua Scott Sokolik.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense stipulates to identification of Defendant; Court accepts. Officer Scott Katzenmeyer sworn in and testified by video. State moves for bind over, Defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.

Attorney Murphy is in a trial. Court finds good cause to extend time limits and reschedule preliminary hearing. State's witness is present by video and victim is present by audio. Both are available for new preliminary hearing date rescheduled by Zoom. Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:30 AM

Adjourned initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Michael Murphy

03:12 PM Defendant Joshua Scott Sokolik appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Joshua Scott Sokolik.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Waiting for public defender to appoint attorney. Bond modified to signature bond with conditions.No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.F., S.C his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with Lyon's Quick Mart or Office Katzenmeyer's family. No intentional contact with Officer Katzenmeyer. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. GPS monitoring. Maintain absolute sobriety. Curfew from 6pm to 6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. Must have active participation in treatment at Clean Slate as recommended by staff and not miss any apppointments. Adjourned initial appearances on September 14, 2022 at 1pm.

3:03 PM   Defendant Joshua Scott Sokolik appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Joshua Scott Sokolik.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for public defender and an attorney to be appointed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

4:25 PM  Defendant Joshua Scott Sokolik appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Joshua Scott Sokolik.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to attorney, address confirmed, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $250 set.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim S.C. or A.F., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  No contact with Lion's Quick Mart.  No intentional contact with Officer Katzenmeyer and no contact with his family.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
